subLessons.name: Academic Writing
subLessons.description: Formal vocabulary for academic papers and essays

vocabularies.description:
To study something in detail to understand it better.
Researchers analyze data to draw conclusions.
We need to analyze the results carefully.

To combine different ideas or things to form a new whole.
The paper synthesizes findings from multiple studies.
Researchers must synthesize information from various sources.

A formal set of ideas intended to explain something.
This theory explains how planets move.
Her theory was supported by the evidence.

An idea or explanation that is suggested but not yet proven.
The scientist developed a hypothesis about climate change.
We need to test this hypothesis.

A system of methods used in a particular area of study.
The research methodology was clearly explained.
They used a new methodology to collect data.

Based on observation or experience rather than theory.
The study provides empirical evidence.
We need empirical data to support this claim.

To have a mutual relationship or connection.
The two variables strongly correlate.
Researchers tried to correlate the findings.

Information discovered as the result of an inquiry or investigation.
The findings were published in a journal.
Preliminary findings suggest a connection.

To suggest or assume the existence or truth of something.
The theory postulates that all matter is made of atoms.
Scientists postulate a connection between the two phenomena.

A possible effect or result of an action or decision.
The study has important implications for future research.
We must consider the implications of these findings.

subLessons.name: Research Methods
subLessons.description: Terms related to conducting and analyzing research

vocabularies.description:
A factor that can change in an experiment.
The dependent variable is affected by the independent variable.
Researchers must control all variables.

A group selected for research that represents a larger population.
The study used a random sample of 1000 participants.
The sample size affects the reliability of results.

A group in an experiment that does not receive the treatment being tested.
The control group received a placebo.
Results are compared with the control group.

Research involving numerical data and statistical analysis.
The study used quantitative methods.
Quantitative data shows measurable changes.

Research focusing on non-numerical data like observations and interviews.
Qualitative research explores personal experiences.
The study used qualitative methods.

To repeat an experiment to verify results.
Other scientists tried to replicate the findings.
The results could not be replicated.

Prejudice that affects the validity of research.
Researchers must avoid bias in their studies.
Selection bias can affect results.

The consistency of research results over time.
The test has high reliability.
Reliability is crucial in research.

The accuracy and truthfulness of research findings.
The study has strong internal validity.
External validity refers to generalizability.

Facts and statistics collected for analysis.
The researchers collected data from surveys.
Raw data must be processed and analyzed.

To give tasks and authority to others.

A structured group working together for a purpose.

Improving organizational efficiency is key.

To encourage and inspire others to work well.
Good leaders know how to motivate their team.
Incentives can motivate employees.

How well a task is completed.
Employee performance is reviewed annually.
The company's performance exceeded expectations.

The ability to guide and inspire others.
Strong leadership is essential for success.
The company needs better leadership.

To put a plan or system into action.
We will implement the new policy next month.
The strategy was successfully implemented.

The ability to work well without wasting resources.
Improving efficiency reduces costs.
Operational efficiency is our priority.

To work together with others.
Teams must collaborate effectively.
Departments collaborate on major projects.

New ideas or methods in business.
Innovation drives company growth.
Technological innovation changes markets.

To buy and sell financial instruments.

The place where financial assets are traded.

The possibility of financial loss.

Money available for investment.
